title: Derrick White, Celtics blow out Suns in second half, win fourth straight: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Derrick White led the Celtics with 22 points and eight assists in a 97-81 win over the Suns.
The Celtics' defense was dominant in the third quarter, limiting the Suns to 11 points and leading a 16-0 run.
Neemias Queta recorded a 14-point, 13-rebound double-double, contributing significantly to the Celtics' win.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 25)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: A condo high-rise at 1 Dalton St. in Boston sold for $14 million, featuring 4,064 square feet and 4 bedrooms.
In Arlington, a condo at 30 Orvis Road was sold for $1.15 million, one of the town's significant sales.
A three-family building at 594 Cabot St. in Beverly sold for $6 million, with 3,140 square feet and 9 bedrooms.

title: How long will Mass. residents have to wait until their power is restored?
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Over 100,000 customers in Eastern Massachusetts remain without power after a blizzard, with full restoration potentially taking a few days.
Eversource and National Grid deployed additional crews and planned responses, with high winds delaying restoration efforts.
Cape Cod and the Islands experienced severe outages; 560 National Grid crews and numerous Eversource teams are in the area.

title: 15 prospects Patriots fans should know entering the 2026 NFL Combine
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots hold 11 picks in the 2026 NFL Draft, including the 31st overall selection.
Top draft prospects include WR KC Concepcion and EDGE Zion Young, each addressing key team needs.
Tight end Kenyon Sadiq and OT Kadyn Proctor are also highlighted as potential fits for the Patriots.

title: Malden school employee on leave after alleged ‘serious incident’ involving high school student
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden police investigate an undisclosed incident involving a school employee now on administrative leave.
The employee works at Linden School in Malden, serving kindergarten through eighth grade students.
No arrests or charges have been filed, and the incident allegedly occurred outside work hours.

title: These Mass. schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massachusetts schools on the South Coast and South Shore closed due to a historic snowstorm that dumped three feet of snow.
Districts with closures include Attleboro, Brockton, Quincy, and Plymouth, while others like Canton and Sharon face delays.
The snowstorm has closed Massachusetts schools for three consecutive days, particularly impacting the regions with the highest snowfall.

title: MBTA to (mostly) resume normal weekday service after historic blizzard
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA to resume regular weekday service on all lines except Fall River/New Bedford due to recent blizzard.
Fall River/New Bedford Commuter Rail will operate on a modified schedule due to severe storm impacts.
Riders advised to plan extra travel time; subscribe to T-Alerts or use MBTA Go app for updates.

title: Curran: Patriots could ‘explore options’ to potentially upgrade from Stefon Diggs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots face a decision on Stefon Diggs, who had over 1,000 receiving yards but a $26.5 million cap hit.
Diggs' contract includes only $1.7 million in guaranteed salary; restructuring may be needed to lower the cap hit.
Patriots might seek a younger player or re-sign Diggs on a reworked deal; his leadership remains valued.

title: Mass. representatives, including minority whip, to skip State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Massachusetts representatives Katherine Clark, Ayanna Pressley, and others will boycott the State of the Union address.
Clark and Pressley criticize Trump's policies, focusing on healthcare, immigration, and economic impacts in their statements.
Senator Ed Markey and Rep. Jim McGovern also plan to skip the address, attending protests instead.

title: Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman won Olympic gold with Team USA, impacting their availability for Bruins' return game Thursday.
The Bruins face the Columbus Blue Jackets at TD Garden, with both teams vying for playoff positioning in the Eastern Conference.
Flight and weather delays have affected McAvoy and Swayman's return, but Team USA teammate Zach Werenski is expected to play.
